title: After working fine for years, Thunderbird now fails to connect at Startup, but has no problem after that
content: I’ve been using Thunderbird for many years, and it has been in my Startup apps for all those years, with no problems. But about a month ago, Thunderbird began failing to connect to the server at startup. It happens most of the time, but not 100% of the time. As soon as I see the failure message pop up, I can go to Thunderbird and click Get Messages, and it retrieves them with no problem. I can see that I’m already connected to the internet when Thunderbird starts, so what could be causing these connection failures at startup?
creator: gf1701

title: How do I stop "THREADING" on ALL Folders
content:
I NEVER used Threading, but after the latest updates ALL my folders are now THREADED. I HATE Threading and the ONLY way I've found to disable Threading is go to EACH Folder and select VIEW-SORT-UNTREADED.

That is insane because I have MANY accounts and MANY folders within.

Is there any way to disable Threading and switch to UNTHREADED without going folder by folder?
creator: Chicks_Hate_Me

title: Thunderbird 115.0 / 115.0.1 - CalDAV does not sync
content:
Hello,

since update to Thunderbird 115.0 (from 102) it seems that the CalDav sync does not work. The items that have been synced when updating to the new version still exist, but modifications (new items, deleted items) do not sync any more.

On my CalDAV server and synced Android calendars everything works. Pushing the synchronization via the menu does not help. I also checked the settings of my 12 calendars, but they are valid.

Is this a known problem or reproducible by others?

Kind regards Florian

title: Migrating Thunderbird, Win 10 to Win 11
content:
Hi.

I've recently set up a new computer. I'm a Thunderbird user.

My old computer is running Windows 10. My new one runs Windows 11. I'm running the same (current) version of TB on both computers.

I can't get my emails to move from one computer to another. I know, this sounds dumb, but it isn't; my email provider uses a weird hybrid of POP3 and IMAP, and just "connecting" didn't do the trick; in fact, adding my account to TB under 11 ate most of my emails on the server because the default TB/POP3 setting kills all old emails after 14 days.

Fortunately, my old emails still live on the Windows 10 computer because it DOESN'T do that.

I have tried export/import, but that doesn't work because my account is very old, very large, and creates a 5GB file. I've tried just MOVING it, but TB isn't picking up the old stuff correctly.

I'm pretty sure this is a TB 10/11 incompatibility for one simple reason: when I export just my address book from the 10 installation the import fails on the new (11) machine, BUT when I export it from another machine that's already running 11 I can import it on the new machine.

How do I export mail from TB on 10 and import on 11 ?

Thanks!
creator: jeff236

title: Creating new folders in thunderbird

I can't remember how I created the other ones, but I'm trying to make an alphabetical system of folders to store the emails I need to keep.What am I doing wrong please? Can you help? Thank you.

title: Thunderbird 115
content:
Hello all together! I have a question concerning the grouped folder functionality in TB 115. But when I switch to the grouped folder view I do not see any mails there in the inbox. No content from any of my accounts at all. Thanks in advance for your support!

Oliver

title: Thunderbird Dark Theme Not Applying to Message Pane / Opened Email
content: I'm having an issue where I'm noticing that Thunderbird is not applying a dark theme to messages that I receive. Most messages show up with a white background. I've tried adjusting the colors under composition, which doesn't do anything for the inbox emails. The only thing that makes a difference is if I change General>Fonts & Colors>Colors>and change the override to "Always", the inbox messages do turn dark as intended, but at the same time it applies a high contrast theme to the client, which is not what I'm looking for (undoubtedly better than nothing). I've tried using Dark Reader, but whenever I click on an email, it flashes white before it turns dark. Any help is appreciated!
creator: nymphlode
